net.sf.juffrou.reflect

Class ReflectionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.juffrou.reflect.ReflectionUtil

  • public final class ReflectionUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods to provide information over generic types.

    When a generic class is extended we often need to know which types were used to typify the generic.

    Author:
    cemartins

      • getClass

        public static Class<?> getClass(Type type)
        Get the underlying class for a type, or null if the type is a variable type.
        Parameters:
        type - the type
        Returns:
        the underlying class

      • getTypeArguments

        public static <T> List<Class<?>> getTypeArguments(Class<T> baseClass,
                                                  Class<? extends T> childClass)
        Get the actual type arguments a child class has used to extend a generic base class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        baseClass - the base class
        childClass - the child class
        Returns:
        a list of the raw classes for the actual type arguments.

      • getTypeArgumentsMap

        public static <T> Map<TypeVariable<?>,Type> getTypeArgumentsMap(Class<T> baseClass,
                                                                Class<? extends T> childClass)
        Get the type parameters and the corresponding actual type arguments a child class has used to extend a generic base class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type
        Parameters:
        baseClass - the base class
        childClass - the child class
        Returns:
        A map where the keys are TypeVariable (the type variables declared by the generic declaration) and the values are the Type objects representing the actual type argument the corresponds.

      • isSimpleType

        public static boolean isSimpleType(Type type)
        Checks whether a type is a simple java type.

        Simple java types are primitives, classes included in the "java" package, Interfaces and Enumerations. Simple java types cannot be java beans, so if this method returns true, you cannot create a BeanWrapper around the specified type.

        Parameters:
        type - the type to test
        Returns:
        true if is a simple java type (is not a bean); false if it is not a simple type (may still not be a bean).

      • getMapFromBean

        public static Map<String,Object> getMapFromBean(Object bean)
        Transform a Java bean into a Map where the keys are the property names.

        If there are nested beans, then the key will be the path of property names in the form "prop1.prop2.prop2".
        Properties with null values are not put in the map.

        Parameters:
        bean - The bean to transform
        Returns:
        a Map with keys and values corresponding to the bean.
        See Also:
        for increased performance.

      • getMapFromBean

        public static Map<String,Object> getMapFromBean(CustomizableBeanWrapperFactory factory,
                                                Object bean)
        Transform a Java bean into a Map where the keys are the property names.

        If there are nested beans, then the key will be the path of property names in the form "prop1.prop2.prop2".
        Properties with null values are not put in the map.

        Parameters:
        factory - a BeanWrapperFactory instance to cache introspection information. Increases performance if re-used.
        bean - The bean to transform
        Returns:
        a Map with keys and values corresponding to the bean.
        See Also:
        getBeanFromMap(CustomizableBeanWrapperFactory, Map, Object)

      • getBeanFromMap

        public static void getBeanFromMap(Map<String,Object> beanMap,
                                  Object bean)
        Fill up a java bean with the contents of a map where the keys are property names.
        Parameters:
        beanMap - Map with property names and values
        bean - bean instance to fill up
        See Also:
        for increased performance.

      • getBeanFromMap

        public static void getBeanFromMap(CustomizableBeanWrapperFactory factory,
                                  Map<String,Object> beanMap,
                                  Object bean)
        Fill up a java bean with the contents of a map where the keys are property names.
        Parameters:
        factory - a BeanWrapperFactory instance to cache introspection information. Increases performance if re-used.
        beanMap - Map with property names and values
        bean - bean instance to fill up
